proposed_strategy.name: Validated Group by Character Count
proposed_strategy.description: This strategy combines consecutive Khandas, strictly ensuring no chunk exceeds the safety character limit of 125,000. Since this document contains only one Khanda and is well below the limit, it forms a single chunk.

parsing_instructions.justification: The Upanishad is primarily divided into Mundakas, which are then subdivided into Khandas. Khandas are the main semantic and structural sections containing a group of Mantras and their associated commentary.
parsing_instructions.numbering_capture_strategy: For the Mantras within a Khanda, extract the Devanagari numeral enclosed within double dandas, often following a bolded verse line, e.g., '।। १ ।।'.

start_pattern.description: A new Khanda begins with a bolded heading indicating its Mundaka and Khanda number, using Sanskrit ordinals.

end_pattern.description: The end of a Khanda's commentary is marked by a concluding colophon line specifying the Mundaka, Khanda, and commentary name.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: No pre-content like a Shanti Patha is present in this document. Parsing should begin directly with the Khanda header identified by the `start_pattern`.
